intro: Boechera exilis, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or gravelly soils. Boechera exilis typically grows in alpine or arctic environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important subject in studies of plant adaptation and evolution.
